question: First impressions matter. What would most likely get you instantly attracted to a guy?

options.label: A
options.text: His style. If he wears something I like, he’s got my interest.

options.label: B
options.text: His humor. If he made me laugh, I’m interested.

options.label: C
options.text: His confidence. If he owns the room, I’m intrigued.

question: You find out he’s been arrested before. Your reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: Depends… what was the charge?

options.label: B
options.text: Total no-go for me.

options.label: C
options.text: None of my business, he paid his debt to society.

question: He’s got the latest iPhone, but his sneakers are falling apart. What do you think?

options.label: A
options.text: A good phone nowadays is essential — approved.

options.label: B
options.text: Maybe he just doesn’t care about looks, and a good phone means more comfort for him.

options.label: C
options.text: That speaks volumes about his priorities… ciao, boy.

question: You catch your new boyfriend being a little too flirty with another girl. How do you handle jealousy?

options.label: A
options.text: I’ll go talk to the girl and get the vibe.

options.label: B
options.text: I’ll go talk to him and get the vibe.

options.label: C
options.text: Even minor suspicion = goodbye.

options.label: D
options.text: I won’t bring it up yet, but if it happens again, we’re having a serious talk.

question: What’s your love language?

options.label: A
options.text: His full attention.

options.label: B
options.text: Receiving gifts.

options.label: C
options.text: Hearing sweet words.

question: What’s your ideal second date?

options.label: A
options.text: A nice dinner where we can actually talk more.

options.label: B
options.text: Casual drinks—see where the night takes us.

options.label: C
options.text: “Let’s just chill at my place.”

question: You meet his friends, and they all give off major player vibes. Your reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: I have some flirty friends too. His friends are not him.

options.label: B
options.text: I won’t judge based on looks alone.

options.label: C
options.text: If it looks like a red flag, smells like a red flag, and acts like a red flag… it ain’t green.

question: Which fragrance instantly draws you to a man?

options.label: A
options.text: Fresh like a deodorant — grass, grapefruit, eucalyptus.

options.label: B
options.text: Rich and deep — leather, tobacco, oud.

options.label: C
options.text: Nothing niche, something classic — wood, bergamot, pine.

options.label: D
options.text: Smells don’t catch me at all.

question: You’re at a restaurant on your second date. While you were in the bathroom, he ordered a drink for you. What do you do?

options.label: A
options.text: I’ll thank him but won’t drink it. I don’t like guys deciding for me.

options.label: B
options.text: If it’s tasty and he’s paying, I’ll take it. Thanks, babe!

options.label: C
options.text: idk what’s in it… I’d ask him to take the first sip, and then maybe I’ll drink.

question: You walk into his apartment for the first time. What do you notice first?

options.label: A
options.text: Is it clean?

options.label: B
options.text: His taste in interior design.

options.label: C
options.text: Signs of another girl being here.

question: He compliments you on something you never thought was compliment-worthy. Your reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: I’d compliment him back.

options.label: B
options.text: I’d joke as a defense and get confused.

options.label: C
options.text: “I know, right? I’m kinda proud of it, too.”

question: Your last situationship ended because…

options.label: A
options.text: We weren’t on the same page about the future.

options.label: B
options.text: He “wasn’t ready for anything serious” but didn’t want to let me go.

options.label: C
options.text: We just drifted apart with no real closure.

question: What kind of gf nickname would feel the most natural for you?

options.label: A
options.text: Something from our inside context, that no one else understands.

options.label: B
options.text: Something that compliments my best sides and boosts my ego.

options.label: C
options.text: Something mocking or funny.

question: Imagine a guy calls you “trouble” — how would you feel?

options.label: A
options.text: Cringe.

options.label: B
options.text: Flattered.

options.label: C
options.text: Hooked.

question: You’re at dinner, and the check comes. What’s your reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: For me it’s natural to pay for myself, I’d insist on paying my half even when he offers to pay.

options.label: B
options.text: I wait to see what he does first — if he offers to split, I’ll agree but be less horny…

options.label: C
options.text: If he asks me to pay 50/50, I’ll leave the money and say we can only be friends.

options.label: D
options.text: I pay for both of us.

question: What kind of compliment makes you melt?

options.label: A
options.text: “You make ignoring other girls way too easy.”

options.label: B
options.text: “You’re such a vibe.”

options.label: C
options.text: “I swear you make everything more fun without even trying.”

question: He texts, “Are you free tonight?” at 10 PM. What’s your first thought?

options.label: A
options.text: Nope. Plans with me need at least a little notice.

options.label: B
options.text: Let’s play and see what he has in mind.

options.label: C
options.text: Omg, he finally texted. *dumb smile*

question: You bring up a serious topic, and he changes the subject to something flirty. What do you do?

options.label: A
options.text: Notice and steer the convo back to something real. I’ll play this game as long as it takes.

options.label: B
options.text: I let it slide as long as the vibe is good. But note he’s not husband material.

options.label: C
options.text: Flirt back — if he’s not ready for serious topics yet, neither am I.

options.label: D
options.text: Bye, boy. I want a man with whom I can discuss everything.

question: He sends you a voice note instead of texting for the first time. How do you feel?

options.label: A
options.text: Nice. I like when guys put in effort to communicate.

options.label: B
options.text: A little weird, but I’ll listen.

options.label: C
options.text: Excited — voices are way more intimate.

question: He says, “I don’t have guy friends. Hanging out with dudes is kinda childish.” Your reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: So… he only “hangs out” with girls?

options.label: B
options.text: That means he’s bad at socializing. Can’t be a good sign.

options.label: C
options.text: That means he’s a trustworthy homebody. Finally!
